gcci.text: The $3.25/hr H100 price reflects tight supply and high capex pressure, incentivizing providers to diversify into older architectures for cost-efficient scaling.

gtpi.text: At $1.28 per million input tokens, the API market is locked in a price war that rewards efficiency but compresses margins, forcing models to compress context and reduce memory.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load highlights grid strain and rising carbon footprint, accelerating data-center nuclear adoption and behind-the-meter generation to stabilize power.

aipi.text: AI sentiment is bullish yet fragile: hardware scarcity, aggressive token pricing, and surging energy loads heighten bubble risks while signaling growth may outpace sustainable margins and grid capacity.
